reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been to another all inclusive resort that was lovely (in Aruba), but didn't compare to this one. We had an ocean front room on the first floor with a huge patio overlooking the ocean and pools. The service was wonderful and the people were the friendliest we have ever come across anywhere. The food was great and it was awesome that our butler made our reservations for us - all four nights - and delivered the confirmations to our room. The spa massage was one of the best I've ever had and my husband loved the golf course as well. Truly a memorable trip. We will definitely be back!
reviews.title: Wonderful spring break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: Well there is a lot of firsts in this trip! It was the first time to every go to an island since prior to this trip I had always driven down the east coast to either South Carolina or Florida. It was also the first time I have ever been to an all inclusive resort. There were a lot of islands and places to choose however I finally selected the Dominican Republic and eventually Iberostar Grand Hotel Bavaro. I have to say that I'm so pleased that I selected this hotel since the food, accommodation, service and activities were all fabulous. I just wanted a place to go that I did not have to worry about anything in order that I could relax, read a book by the beach and finally enjoy some sun after a long winter in Canada. The thing I liked was that you could just that and relax or if you wanted to get involved in all of the activities that are going on at the hotel. There is no question that I will be returning again next year. It's money well spent!
reviews.title: First time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the IGBH from March 29th til April 5th 2013.and we enjoyed every minute of it. If we go back to DR we will go back to this resort for sure! It started with the private transportation which was rapid and courteous.The welcome arrival was correct but nothing extravagant. Our room had the ocean view. It was small compare to other resort we where in but very very clean and this those matter a lot for us. Our room butler give us a professional and very well detailed informations regarding all the resort services.The IGBH has beautiful gardens, its spacious. The hall has always fresh flowers it has great surroundings.. One must be careful when walking because the floors are very slippery and it might be dangerous when wet.The beach entertaining is just amazing. The beach drink services is a little too much. They should be more discreet. One time within one hour we where asked five time if we wanted something to drink. It's far too much. We know that receiving tips might be their goal but one must also respect the customers needs. There where small sandhill around many palapas. Those should be leveled by the maintenance people because it's unconfortable. We are early birds and personnaly I'm at the beach at +or- 06h30 waiting for the sunrise then going to the buffet. After that little cleaning at the room for aprx 15 minutes then under the sun for the entire day except lunch time. Well although it did not affect us, I have seen towels on some chair before I arrive and those chairs being empty for 5-6 hours.Just disgusting The room services is perfect. As far as the restaurants are concerned, frankly we where not impressed. Beside the Italian one all the others where ordinary and for us, the Japanese food was tasteless. But again that's always different from one person to another!! As strange as it could sound, we eated very well at the two buffets. Beside a few servers that had almost no smile, all of the remaining of the staff always had them. There is something that made really a good impression on us. During our stay, management conduct a customer appreciation survey that was made with a majordome (verbally) and at the buffet (written questionnaire). This second one was made by a private businees firm. For us, when an enterprise takes the time to spend money for a survey inquiring how their customers appreciate their level of services, then this entreprise care about their customers. We salute that. I would not hesitate to recommend this resort but I would recommend having an ocean view..
reviews.title: An enjoyable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This resort is absolutely incredible! This resort was truly everything we hoped for and more. We had one of the ocean front hotel suites - magnificent view, extraordinary service and the most relaxing, up scale experience! We could have not wanted for more! The staff in the dining room, pool, beach was extraordinary. We would definitely stay at an Iberostar in another country!
reviews.title: Incredible Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: This was our second time to this resort in just over a year.
reviews.title: 2nd Time Around

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Arrival and Check-in:
reviews.title: Awesome vacation! :D

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A breeze! We received a warm welcome, a cool towel and beverage and check-in was a snap - thank-you, Edwards! It was also nice to see the Trip Advisor awards for the past two years proudly displayed behind the check-in counter!
reviews.title: Outstanding Property!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room/Butler & Maid Service:
reviews.title: Wonderfull ans amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Large and very clean! Maid service is excellent at this resort, and there are always butlers about to cater to your every whim! Keep your eye out for Luis and Pastor who are just excellent to deal with and go out of their way for their guests! They are such hard-workers and genuine nice people! The bed was a lovely king-size (I slept like a rock!), and we especially loved the bathroom with the jacuzzi tub! I will say that turning on the whirlpools in the tub did create quite an unpleasant smell in the room - perhaps a run through of cleaning solution on a regular basis would take care of this. The terra cotta oil burner/diffuser in our room (and throughout the hotel!) was a lovely touch - either filled with orange oil or apple cinnamon oil and lit every evening (*for all you motorcycle enthusiasts out there ... smells just like Lucas Slick Mist! LOL). We NEVER ran out of fresh towels, always had towel art, and were very pleased with how quickly the fridge and chips were restocked.
reviews.title: Perfect way to relax!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Restaurants/Buffet:
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Iberostar Grand Bavaro Hotel the week of March 18th, 2013.
reviews.title: Great couples vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very pleased with the entire experience that this property had to offer.
reviews.title: A Almost Perfect Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The service was excellent. We stayed in an Ocean View Jr. Suite. The butlers that were assigned to our room were first rate, particularly Henry and Ceasar. At our request they prepared a bubble bath for us in the jacuzzi tub each night of our stay. If we needed anything all we had to do was let them know and they took care of it.
reviews.title: Relaxing Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The entire property including the grounds, pool, beach and hotel itself was very well maintained and extremely clean.
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013
reviews.text: The service at the beach and at the pools was excellent. Someone was always available to take drink orders. The activity staff was frequently asking if we wanted to participate in volleyball, archery, bingo etc. with no pressure at all. The cabanas at the pools were fabulous and made it very comfortable to “lounge” by the pool all day long. I wish there was a better way to reserve a pool cabana, it was a little inconvenient to have to wake up early to secure a cabana (but it was still totally worth it).
reviews.title: An experience like none other

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Each year, my sister and I go on vacation. This is my second time at an Iberostar resort and her third. As the trip came near, we called the hotel from Canada to specifically request an upgrade to our room, we wanted a room with a swim up pool and were told of the cost and that they would make note on our file. We would have to ask for it once we arrived...I was so excited to find that we could indeed upgrade as we drank our first pina colada at reception. The cost was $280. each but we thought was so worth it! We gladly paid.
reviews.title: Seriously conflicted!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012
reviews.text: The room is great, the private pool also great! What's not so great.....the NOISE from the staff, trucks, motorcycles and radio at the meeting place outside our room. We asked to be moved and this is where I start to be conflicted with how I feel about the hotel...we were offered a non swim up room with a view but would have to pay more (seriously? More on top of the $560. upgrade?). We were told that there were no other vacancies for swim up, that is, until we talked to our vacation rep the next day...she arranged another room but we would have to wait until it was made up. We promptly went to our room and packed up, then headed to the pool. We had a great first day and met some fun people....service was super! Once back at our room, we were told we couldn't move rooms, not sure of the reason, we had been told a couple of things at this point. So, uncharacteristically, I kicked up a fuss (admittedly, the drinks at the main pool may have helped with this) and so Melissa arrived at our room to sort out the situation. She was very patient and seemed concerned and again we were offered a non swim up room....clearly the noise from staff was not going away but I really did like the room. Melissa gave us a refund on our upgrade...greatly appreciated. Caution to those of you wanting the swim up room experience.....not peaceful!
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, great food, great service... Most of the time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: So now we are settled in, we now see that the other swim ups are vacant....again, not sure why our move was denied....could it be they are under renovation? The smell of fresh paint that now wafts into our room in the afternoons could be a clue.
reviews.title: Wonderful Resort!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My sister and I are both in customer service and so we completely understand that things can happen and that you can't make everyone happy, all the time. It's simply not in my character to complain however, now my sister lies in bed from some kind of stomach bug while I type this. We have not yet told the hotel that she is so sick...again, things happen, you run this risk when abroad. But then, I started reading some of these reviews and decided to comment.
reviews.title: Great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We leave tomorrow and I hope she feels much better for the long (2 flight) trip home.
reviews.title: Excellent... could have been perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from our honeymoon at the Grand Bavaro. It was an amazing week filled with great service, friendly staff, and wonderful facilities. I would recommend this resort to anyone looking for a great getaway. The resort itself had wonderful rooms, good restaurants, excellent pools, wonderful amenities. The staff however is what really sets the resort above the others. The Star Friends were friendly and we had a ton of fun playing games and doing activities with them. If you stay make sure you meet Rosy who is an excellent bartender at the pool! She was the sweetest person ever. Go! Enjoy a restful vacation where you do not have to lift a finger, or worry about what happens next.
reviews.title: Restful Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Iberostar Grand Bavaro is almost a perfect place to stay. The staff at this hotel go out of there way to be nice and serve your every need.
reviews.title: Greatest Birthday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. Every room has Butler service. These guys are really helpful. Anything you ask for they will get done for you. Make sure to tip them.
reviews.title: Outstanding place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: 2. Bartenders make great drinks. The drinks here are great. The only negative is that unlike the Iberostar Grand Mexico they only stock cheap liquor at the pool bar. All the other bars have the good stuff.
reviews.title: perfect getaway!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3. Wine. The wine here is really good wine.
reviews.title: Wonderful vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes, the resort is beautiful, the food is excellent, but that's information that is in every review. Lets talk about who makes this resort a place that everyone is raving about, its the staff.
reviews.title: THE BEST VACATION EVER!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The GM, Mr. Ricardo Dominguez whom you should all know, he's the well dressed, soft spoken gentlemen who is out and about shaking hands, introducing himself and making sure you are happy. He is definetly a class act.
reviews.title: Free nights promised, but no response....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband & I have been going to Iberostars for over 10 years, the pictures speak for themselves. You can't lose if you go to the Iberostar Grand Bavaro. The food is amazing as well as the rooms & the perfect customer service.
reviews.title: Awesome vacation at a beautiful resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would like to personally thank Nicole, Rosy, Laura,& all the servers at the buffet. We would also like to give a special thanks to Jeovanny, Freddy, & Juan Carlos, {front desk}. They are the best.
reviews.title: Cool place for honeymooners

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for five nights last October. We had several problems, fire in the workout facility put it out of commission, construction, night club closed some nights, etc. and were given a voucher for two free nights. We have been trying to use that voucher but cannot get anyone to return our calls or emails. We calle the number given, but they hung up, we emailed twice and even went to the Iberostar web page and filled out a customer service form. Still no response.
reviews.title: We expected too much.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was amazing! From the time you get there until the time you leave, the staff is at your service. They are extremely attentive and are very friendly. The hotel is peaceful and the beach/pool areas are very clean. There is always food/drink available. To top it all off, there is a butler available whenever you need to help take care of any extra luxuries you may desire. This hotel blew away both of our expectations, and they were high. :)
reviews.title: Amazing Honeymoon Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not sure what to say that hasn’t been mentioned a thousand times over already. This place is awesome in large part because of the staff. I wanted to mention them by name, but feared I would leave someone out. So, to all the Star Friends, food preparers and service staff- thanks for making our vacation the best we have ever experienced!
reviews.title: The Coveted reelfreak Five Circle Award!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Most of the Star Friends knew my name by the second day, and those who didn’t know our names still recognized our faces and always had a friendly word. The same can be said about the staff working the buffet and the servers on the beach. I am not sure of her official title, but even the head chef / food operations supervisor took time out to say hello and ask us how everything was almost every day.
reviews.title: Fabulous Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food and drinks were much better than we expected. The variety and quality of items available was excellent. We enjoyed everything including our meals at the Italian, Japanese and Surf and Turf ala carte restaurants. We emailed ahead for reservations, and they were confirmed when we arrived. We were even able to change one of our reservations to dine with another couple we met while we were there.
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: Our room was very nice. It was on the second floor looking across the resort towards the ship and the restaurants. The only negative was the people above us. Someone up there was non-stop motion and they walked with the heaviest feet. My wife and I laughed because we couldn’t figure out where they were walking as the rooms are not that large. Fortunately, they didn’t keep us up at night and by the time they were up and moving, we were ready to get up ourselves. The bed and room temperature were extremely comfortable and the room was always clean.
reviews.title: You have to see it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently returned from a one week vacation to Punta Cana, staying the first 3 nights at Gran Bahia Principe Ambar and the last 4 nights at Iberostar Grand Bavaro.
reviews.title: ANOTHER GREAT IBEROSTAR GRAND..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While both resorts are adult only and all inclusive, the are quite different and be enjoyed both of them.
reviews.title: Best hotel in Punta Cana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Iberostar Grand Bavaro is simply beautiful in design, artwork and layout of the resort. The grounds are magnificent and constantly maintained. This is also a smaller resort within the mega Iberostar complex which offers the options to explore the other properties within the complex. The room, while smaller than other Iberostar Grands I have visited, was contemporary in design with a very interesting spa tub that faced the courtyard with electric blinds on 2 sides. Very cool! Butler is also included and dinner reservations were made by him. Dining reservations a little difficult to get, but we found if we checked at the restaurant the day we wanted to dine, there was not a problem. I think in peak season it would be a good idea to make your dining reservations in advance. The Italian restaurant left a little to be desired but the gourmet restaurand and the steak and seafood restaurants were great. Iberostar is still serving plenty of lobster both for dinner and lunch. Free wi-fi in room and it worked well. The public areas were truly unique works of art! The full sized ship in the courtyard serves as a night club/sports bar inside and cocktails and entertainment on the deck outside. Iberostar "shines" with their entertainment in their inside theater. "Rock Show" was extremely entertaining (we don't usually go to the shows). Also serves good wine and top shelf alcohol. We really love this resort even though it is prices, it is well worth it. We would positively return and highly recommend Iberostar Grand Bavaro. P.S. - They also had time share people, but were very low key.
reviews.title: Honeymoon in Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Read my review of Gran Bahia Principe.
reviews.title: Fantastic Time!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything was absolutely perfect. The food was great and the animations were excellent!!! My husband and I enjoyed ourselves so much and we definitely plan on returning. The service was excellent!!
reviews.title: One of the best in punta cana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed Iberostar grand. The food is the best we have had in the Dominican.
reviews.title: Very Clean and nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I arrived on April 18th at the Iberostar. Our room was not ready for three hours at which time we were upgraded to the Grand Bavaro. The property is beautiful and is immaculate. The beach is the best in the area and chairs are always available which is a big plus. When we travelled before I would have to get up early and run out and place a towel on the chairs to reserve them. The food at the resort was top notch at all the restaurants. What made this trip unforgetable was the employees. We had a great time. "Happy Feet", Henry, and Regui were fantastic. Daily they went way out of their way to make sure we had a great time. This is our fourth time that we have stayed at a Iberostar Resort even though I enjoyed them all this was the best one. I would highly recommend this resort.
reviews.title: Excellent Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my hubby had this vacation all lined up. We had not been on a honeymoon when we married 5 yrs ago. This was a very relaxing. Location great, great resturants, great time.The room was omg. And those beef fillets, mmmmm.
reviews.title: a long time coming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This review was written 2 years ago, but never posted. Since we just returned from the Iberostar Grand Rose Hall in Jamaica and we posted a review about it, we felt we should post this one too.
reviews.title: Very close to perfection and highly recommended (A European Review)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Iberostar Grand Bavaro in Punta Cana for 10 days. It was our first time at the resort. We are Europeans so it's a ten hour flight for us to arrive in Punta Cana. Upon arrival, our tiresome flight was quickly forgotten when we were greeted with warm, wet towels to cleanse our hands, a Pina Colada and a glass of champagne. While we had not slept for over 36 hours at the time being, the warm welcome and beautiful location – simply put, the hotel is just gorgeous - was energizing enough to keep us going until nightfall. A special recommendation goes to Juan the bell boy, who is an entertaining fellow.
reviews.title: If you are too lazy to read the rest of this review, conclusion is: BOOK IT!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband I went the the Iberostar Grand in the Dominican Republic for our 10th anniversary. We had stayed at Grand Rose Hall previously in Jamaica. Our experience is Jamaica was absolutely the best so I was expecting the same attention to detail and service at the Grand Bavaro. We went on Sept 19th 2013 through the 22nd. I had planned to surprise my husband with the Romantic dinner on the beach, I had it planned down to every detail- until it rained. I was assured I wouldn't be charged the $300 for the dinner. I was- we are going on two weeks and my money has yet to be returned. The mini bar was never stocked the way we asked. We had to ask for things several times. Not a complete disappointment, but I really felt let down. Breakfast and lunch were good, dinners were average. We will not be going back.
reviews.title: It's okay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: From the moment we stepped out of the shuttle we were taken care of. We were greeted warmly and given fresh moist towels to freshen up and a cocktail as we stepped into the lobby. Everything went smoothly and as we arrived a little early for check-in, we were directed to the restaurant for lunch while we waited for our room.
reviews.title: We didn't want to go home!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was outstanding - Maria, Winston and Ricardo were great getting guests into the activities. We attended a show one evening that Ricardo spoke about and were thrilled at the talent of those on stage that night. Great voices and routines :)
reviews.title: The Best Trip Yet! - Honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Elias, Jose and Victor Manuel took excellent care of us in the dinning rooms - always with a smile and we were greeted warmly every time we came in to be seated.
reviews.title: Honeymoon Stay. A few issues

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013
reviews.text: The food was delicious, the coffee was perfect and there was plenty of choices to choose from. My only negative is the holding temps of food on display (yes - I am in the food business) I avoided anything not prepared in front of me (still had a lot to choose from) and although I would have loved many of the items in the glass domes and on platters - I was not convinced it was safe to eat. I would have preferred to see more ice and to see staff constantly switching out products that were on display on the platters. We also have 2 vegetarians in our family - this became difficult a couple times.
reviews.title: The perfect honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012
reviews.text: The best hotels all inclusive I never stayed. We moved to this hotel from Majestic Elegance Hotel where we were very disappointed wirh service and infraestructure maintenance.
reviews.title: Oustanding hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Grand Bavaro Iberiostar, on the contrary, fullfilled all our expectations and more: service is fantastic and staff are extrmely friendly and helpful. All the facilities are incredible and rooms warm and elegants.
reviews.title: Best time, EVER!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The waiter Jose Luis Bonifacio was an extremely friendly and professional.
reviews.title: A little piece of heaven.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: Only I can add that is was one of our best holidays
reviews.title: Another Huge Successful Vacation 10+ Iberostar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Husband and I came to celebrate our 20th anniversary four days over Memorial Day weekend 2012 and it was wonderful. The staff, food, drinks, beach & pool, accomodations (oceanview), nightly entertainment and golf were 100%. It was peaceful and relaxing; love the fact it's "adults-only". Except for a cruise I've never stayed at an all-inclusive resort...this is the way to go. No out of pocket costs except for tips and souveniers. Can't wait to go back next year!
reviews.title: Great Honeymoon, DEFINITELY RECOMMEND if you are going to Punta Cana!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from our honeymoon at the iberostar grand bavaro hotel. Before booking our trip I researched many all inclusive resorts in the Caribbean. I read almost every review I could find and that's what sold me on this resort and they were totally right! My husband ( who is just about the pickiest person I've ever met) and I could not find one thing to complain about at the end of our trip. The food was AMAZING, the staff, butlers, managers were so accommodating. The beaches were beautiful. We went during a slower time of the year and it was great because we could go down to the pool or beach at any time and find a cabana or lounge chairs. They served top shelf liquor, many times without us even asking for it. If you are still thinking about whether to book this resort or not, don't waste anymore time just book it! If you want a great deal, we booked with Amy at beach bum vacations who was great and also booked all our dinner reservations in advance. We don't even know where to go next because we can't find a resort to top this!
reviews.title: honeymoon sept 8-17th

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The weather was beautiful, and the hotel grounds, lobby and common areas were all very nice. Our room was also very nice and clean. Our butler was a no show after greeting us shortly after our arrival. We had a very detailed conversation about our wishes for dining at the different restaurants. We wrongly assumed the butler had taken of everything as he said he would. The next night we realized he had not made any reservations for us. We called the desk and they made us couple reservation were and when they could. We arrived for dinner the next night only to find out we didn't have a reservation. Again we went to the desk and after a half hour we were told everything was full the rest of the week. We had two average dinner experiences. The rest of the nights we had room service. It was delivered in a timely manner and the food was decent in fact I preferred it to the dinner buffet. The wait staff in the main dinning area was ok. They failed to deliver food items to our table and a few rude comments that were muttered in spanish didn't go unnoticed. The pool and bar area were nice. Some bartenders were better than others and the drinks were weak but that was little concern for us. The fitness area was pretty decent and we managed to have decent training sessions. We had a great time, but it didn't live up to the high rating.
reviews.title: It's hard trying to live up to the hype.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: After reading all the hype, we booked thinking it was a guarantee. We were very disappointed. I know people on the islands have a different way of life, and don't earn a lot, but we were asked several times by different staff to give them money for new shoes or money to feed their kids! One girl approached my wife and asked her how much her diamond ring cost. She said for that amount She could buy a village and then proceeded to blatantly ask us for $200 because her mother had some disease and needed some medicine. As a physician, I questioned her and nothing she was saying was even close to the truth or symptoms of her ailment so I knew she was lying. Not to be arrogant, this is unacceptable. I have been to many 5 star hotels and this was the first time I was actually harassed. I guess word goes around fast amongst the staff when they have a good tipper in the house! Found it a real turn off. Found the staff of the morning buffet a bit rude, especially when you ask to sit in a specific area! Had a small issue one day in our room. So when we were in the lobby we decided to go to the desk. upon approaching the front desk staff about it, found we were dismissed rudely, and it seemed like we were interrupting their telephone call. Was promised issue would be rectified, however it wasn't. We tipped our maid, and she took care of it.
reviews.title: Disappointment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms were nice, can see things getting a little tired. Overall the food was good, wine selection was fine and the alcohol and beverage choices were great.
reviews.title: Thank you Iberostar Grand!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pools were great and able to go for great walks along the beach.
reviews.title: Iberostar Grand

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I are experienced travellers, so can compare our experience at Iberostar Grand Bavaro to, say RIU Palace Mexico in the Mayan Riviera or Celebrity cruise ships. Each of the above claims to be a 5-star accommodation; however Iberostar is far behind others and is not really a 5-star resort based on our experience. Here is what is good, average and bad at Iberostar.
reviews.title: Good, but not a 5-Star Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good
reviews.title: Wonderful vacation in an outstanding resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. Property - very nicely designed and maintained, beautifully appointed rooms. The resort was built in 2009, so it is shiny and very attractive visually.
reviews.title: Beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. Beach - wide, with white sand; a lot of shade and lounges.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3. Beach service - nice and friendly hardworking people running around to deliver a drink of your choice to you.
reviews.title: grand bavaro iberostar punta cana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I took my second trip to Punta Cana in may of this year. ( my first stay was at the Excellence PC, in 2006, which I loved,)
reviews.title: There are much better 5 star properties out there....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at the Iberostar and were greeted with drinks and a cool towel. Lovely! We were escorted to our room by our butler, and the room was cool and airy, however our view was of the regular Iberostar and looking down, the swim-up rooms. (NO privacy)
reviews.title: Pretty Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were told by our butler we should make dinner reservations for the week. This is where things went downhill . Every restaurant he called from our room was either sold out, or had odd times to dine. We reserved the odd times, and were told he would keep trying.
reviews.title: Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We then waited for our luggage. And waited, and waited.
reviews.title: Punta Cana's BEST

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1 hour later we were at the pool. The pool here is beautiful and meandering. The pool bar was lively.
reviews.title: Still #1 rated!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our vacation was fantastic. My husband and I stayed at the Iberostar Grand from September 15th through September 21st. I did some pretty extensive research on trip advisor before making my choices and I am really glad I did.
reviews.title: Excellent resort, top notch vacation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked through Orbitz and everything went smoothly. We chose to reserve ground transportation to and from the airport to the resort when booking our vacation. I would highly recommend doing this. Each travel site (ie, Orbitz, Expedia, Apple) has a “travel agent” company that they are associated with. Orbitz’s, as it turns out, is “VIP Travel.” Once you arrive in the airport, you will go through customs, get your luggage and then meet with a concierge type person. This person will take your transportation voucher and point you in the right direction.
reviews.title: Perfect Resort For Us!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On a side note about the concierge type person at the airport: along with giving us some helpful tips (don’t drink the water, the exchange rate, etc.) he gave us a super hard sell about going to the Hard Rock Hotel and Casino. He gave us a map of the area and kind of pointed out where Iberostar Grand was, but circled Hard Rock and drew stars all around it. He told us to call Hard Rock and that we could get $100 to gamble with, free transportation to and from our resort and free spa treatments. We were then told on the sly by another airport employee not to fall for it and that it was a time share sell trap. We also learned from other travelers later in our vacation that Hard Rock does indeed push (very aggressively) time shares. This is another plus about Iberostar Grand. We did not get a single time share push the entire time we were there. The resort is classy. There is an information area where you could go and inquire about Iberostar’s other properties and time share information, but no one will ever suggest it to you.
reviews.title: Couldn't ask for a better stay for our honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The VIP Travel ground transportation takes you right to the resort (ride is about 45 minutes). Now you’re in paradise. We were immediately greeted by a bell hop who gave us cool towels to wipe our face and hands with. It was really refreshing and luxurious after hours of airports and travel. We then checked in. Rangui checked us in and was so welcoming and professional. He treated us so well and we immediately felt like we were staying in a very nice resort. While Rangui was giving us a lay of the land, a cocktail waitress came up with a tray with champagne and pina coladas. While we were deciding which to chose, we were told to take both. This set the tone for the luxurious way we would be treated throughout our stay.
reviews.title: Third Times a Charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You will have two butlers (day shift and night shift) to take care of your needs. Ours were Jason and Gomez and they were attentive, kind and excellent. They will draw you a bath in your room at any day or time that you like. We had two. Both were beautiful (bubbles, rose petals) and romantic (aromatic bath salts, champagne on ice). Our butler(s) dropped a newspaper off to my husband every morning. They also made sure our mini fridge was stocked with what we like (tonic water, Bombay Saphire Gin, Vodka, fresh limes, etc) daily. They also took care of dinner reservations flawlessly.
reviews.title: BEAUTIFUL PERFECT HONEYMOON!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: After months of research and reading other reviews on TripAdvisor, I felt fairly confident in choosing the Iberostar Grand Bavaro for our first grown-ups only trip with my sister in law and her husband. We'd spent hours reading other traveler reviews and watching slideshows of pictures from other reviewers...we managed to get so excited we were worried that we would set our expectations too high and be disappointed. We should not have worried! The resort is everything it appears to be in pictures, and even better than the reviews prepared us to expect- from the moment we stepped off the shuttle van to the moment we had to leave, we were in paradise.
reviews.title: Spoiled Rotten @ Iberostar Grand Bavaro!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The property: the design of the property is imposing and regal, and the decor impressive. Low, comfortable couches scattered between tall columns; beautifully landscaped gardens with winding paths; gorgeous hallways with mirrors, artwork, sculpture and private conversation spaces....somehow, the resort manages to feel huge and intimate at the same time. The layout, with the rooms, restaurants and shops framing the central garden and pool area, makes the space feel cozy and private; yet at no time did we feel cramped or crowded. And it is all so very, very clean. Every morning the staff of the Iberostar is out mopping, sweeping, dusting - it felt immaculately clean and well-maintained. The bathrooms are all so beautifully appointed (each area has different themed bathrooms - it's worth it to try to see them all!) and clean....The pool area was large and laid out in such a way that all of the chairs and cabanas felt close to the water. The beach was pristine and the water as blue as the pictures make it appear. The beach staff keep the area clean and the palapas were spaced well apart for privacy. Everything about the look and feel of the resort was perfect....
reviews.title: Pure relaxation and luxury!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms: we were on the 4th floor in the center section, so we had incredible views of the garden, pool and ocean. We'd get up early each morning to sit on our balcony and feel the breeze roll in from the water and marvel at how beautiful everything looked! The bed was comfortable and large, the air conditioning was AMAZING, the bathroom was spacious and we had all of the amenities we needed. We didn't spend much time in the room, but we were very comfortable in it!
reviews.title: Best Resort in DR

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The food: better than most all-inclusives. The breakfast and lunch buffets were not exciting, but the food always appeared to be very fresh. The restaurants were VERY fun and very good. We ate at the hibachi on our first night and had a wonderful, silly time with our chef and tablemates. The food is standard for the chain Japanese steakhouses we have at home, tasty and in large quantities. We also ate at the Italian restaurant, which gets some less-than-stellar reviews here, but which we enjoyed immensely. The food was presented beautifully and was very good, in portions that were entirely more than we could eat. We really loved the surf and turf, which had an excellent variety of dishes and all cooked very well. We were a little disappointed that crab legs seemed to be still frozen instead of served hot, but as they were only an appetizer, we just skipped over them. The wine served with the meals is pretty middle of the road, but absolutely drinkable. The non-wine lovers in our party had cocktails instead. The bars serve snacks as well as drinks, and all of the drinks are poured pretty strong!! Room service was a little disappointing as all of the food was cold by the time it reached our rooms - if you choose to order room service, consider ordering already-cold items, like the fruit trays.
reviews.title: Top Resort in Punta Cana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The people, the people, the people: The very best part about this resort is its staff, every single one of whom work hard to make our vacations wonderful. I never walked past anyone in Iberostar uniform who didn't make it a point to greet me and ask me how my trip was going. The lovely women who were cleaning (they are ALWAYS cleaning and keeping things beautiful) would pause to say hello, the gentlemen cleaning the flamingo pond would smile and wave- everyone at the resort makes it a point to be welcoming and friendly. We met some incredible people here. Lely, who was our favorite beach & pool bar server, had an amazing sense of humor; Leticia found us every single day to check in and make sure we were having as much fun as possible; Boom-Boom was an ever-present entertainment - his entire job seemed to be walking around checking in to see that you were doing something enjoyable....Maria helped us play silly games on her birthday...our wonderful butler, Kelvin, seemed to materialize every time we had questions or needed anything. Abdul, who worked in the bell service area, kept us entertained as he drove us around the adjoining resorts. Everyone in the resort worked HARD to keep us happy yet it never felt like an effort. It's hard to imagine people being that naturally happy all the time, but they really seemed to be happy to help. We were grateful for their presence.
reviews.title: Honest Review
